ygData.subject: Re: Binding (sigh)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yeah but rearrangeable spellbooks are not a balance issue of the game. There were no downsides of it, no impact to determine. Not a single person was upset
ygData.messageBody:
>> No, it's not an argument, but it really does end the
>> conversation. No matter how you or anyone feels about
>> it, and we've seen many many long winded posts, Verant
>> won't do it. Period. All that's left is pointlessly
>> arguing over why Verant "should".
>
>Eeent. Next contestant please. You're wrong. Period.
>
>They said rearrangable spellbooks (my favorite example
>at the moment) would never happen. Guess what..


Yeah but rearrangeable spellbooks are not a balance issue of the game. There
were no downsides of it, no impact to determine. Not a single person was
upset about it. No one created a petition about it after it was put in.

Giving bind to one class would make many people upset ("If they get it, why
can't we??"). Giving it to ALL classes would completely change the dynamics
of the game.

I won't say that it will not happen, though I seriously doubt it will. But,
I will say that rearrangebale spellbooks are a very bad example. :)

Daleia
